oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Benevolent Cemetery sign
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gardner, Leigh Ann
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Cemeteries
African American cemeteries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white image of the stone sign for the Benevolent Society #16 Cemetery.

The Benevolent Society was an African American lodge that offered sickness and burial benefits to its members. There were hundreds of Benevolent Society lodges located throughout the state of Tennessee during the late 19th and 20th centuries.
